thread.title: Ritchie Bros. to conduct back-to-back equipment auctions in Utah on September 29 & 30
thread.title_full: Ritchie Bros. to conduct back-to-back equipment auctions in Utah on September 29 & 30 - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Ritchie Bros. to conduct back-to-back equipment auctions in Utah on September 29 & 30
text:
Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers
September 29 auction at Ritchie Bros.' permanent Salt Lake City site features 850+ items; September 30 one-owner auction for Shurtleff & Andrews Corporation features 3,450+ items
SALT LAKE CITY , Sept. 18, 2015 /CNW/ - Ritchie Bros. ( rbauction.com ), the world's largest industrial auctioneer, will conduct back-to-back unreserved public equipment auctions in Utah on September 29 & 30, 2015. The September 29 auction will be held at Ritchie Bros.' permanent Salt Lake City auction site, and features equipment items from dozens of owners. On September 30 , Ritchie Bros. will conduct a one-owner, complete dispersal auction for the Shurtleff & Andrews Corporation at their site. Shurtleff & Andrews is a Utah -based heavy industrial structural steel and mechanical erection company that has operated for 65+ years. More than 4,300 equipment items and trucks will be sold in the two auctions, including cranes, rigging & accessories, boom lifts, scissor lifts, wheel loaders, excavators, motor graders, truck tractors, trailers and more. Bidders can participate in the auctions in person, online at rbauction.com and by proxy.
"The Shurtleff & Andrews Corporation has worked on hundreds of projects across the United States and their equipment fleet is second-to-none," said Ron Moss , Regional Sales Manager, Ritchie Bros. "This is a unique opportunity for interested buyers to purchase equipment and tools from one of the most well-respected steel erection contractors in the nation. The day before the Shurtleff & Andrews auction, we will hold another unreserved public auction at our permanent Salt Lake City site, selling more than 850 items for dozens of owners across the state. All items in both auctions will be sold without minimum bids or reserve prices."
Describing their equipment, Glen Shurtleff , Vice President of Shurtleff & Andrews, said, "All of our equipment has been maintained at the highest level, which has allowed us to perform our work with minimal downtime. We're known for the quality of our equipment across the country."
"In fact, a lot of our equipment and tools are brand new and have never been used," added Matt Nelson , President of Shurtleff & Andrews. "We've got everything anyone would need from a steel erection standpoint, from cranes and trucks to safety equipment, small tools and rigging."
September 30 (Shurtleff & Andrews) auction details:
Location: Shurtleff & Andrews, 1875 West 500 South, Salt Lake City, Utah , 84104 Starts at 9 a.m. local time Contact: +1.385.831.6360 Full details can be found at rbauction.com Equipment highlights: Three American 11320 450-ton crawler cranes Two American 9310 225-ton crawler cranes Two 2008 Link-Belt RTC8065 65-ton rough terrain cranes Two American 7530 125-ton 8x4x4 conventional truck cranes A Link-Belt HTC8670 70-ton 8x4x4 hydraulic truck crane Five 2008 JLG 1350SJP 4x4x4 boom lifts
September 29 auction details:
Starts at 8 a.m. local time Location: Ritchie Bros.' auction site at 1428 East Hardy Rd., Lake Point, Utah , 84074 Contact: +1.801.250.1836 Full details can be found at rbauction.com/SaltLakeCity Equipment highlights: A 2005 CEC 6X16 Roadrunner 6' x 16' two-deck portable screening plant A Trail King TK170MDG 85-ton 3+3+3 lowboy A 2008 Metso LT1213 crawler impact crusher A 2006 Caterpillar 16H VHP motor grader
Ritchie Bros. will continue accepting equipment consignments in the coming weeks; call+1.801.250.1836 for information.
About Ritchie Bros.
Established in 1958, Ritchie Bros. (NYSE and TSX: RBA) is the world's largest seller of used equipment for the construction, transportation, agriculture, material handling, energy, mining, forestry, marine and other industries. Ritchie Bros. TM solutions make it easy for the world's builders to buy and sell equipment with confidence, including live unreserved public auctions with on-site and online bidding ( rbauction.com ), the EquipmentOne TM secure online marketplace ( EquipmentOne.com ), a professional corporate asset management program, and a range of value-added services, including equipment financing for customers through Ritchie Bros. Financial Services ( rbauction.com/financing ). Ritchie Bros. has operations in 19 countries, including 44 auction sites worldwide. Learn more at RitchieBros.com .
Photos for media are available at rbauction.com/media .
